newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippine peso recovers after death rumours.
newsitem.headline: Philippine peso recovers after death rumours.

text.p: The Philippine peso closed at 26.225 to the dollar on Thursday, recovering from a 26.235 low in heavy trading sparked by a false rumour that Defence Secretary Renato de Villa had been assassinated, traders said.
Volume totalled $180 million, nearly twice the daily average for the Philippine foreign exchange market.
"There was panic buying on the dollar. Everybody thought that because of the assassination, foreign funds would be pulling out of the (equities) market," one trader at a local bank said.
Aides to de Villa emphatically denied the rumours that swept the forex market that the defence chief was dead, saying he had spent the afternoon in a budget meeting.
